conclusion: To determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to follow the paths of each stream of liquid labeled A, B, C, and D.
Liquid A (Yellow) starts from the top left.
Liquid A flows toward the center, diverting around the red baffle.
Liquid A continues downward between the green and gray baffles.
Liquid A eventually flows into container F.
Liquid B (Cyan) begins at the top next to A.
Liquid B flows directly downward between the red and gray baffles.
Liquid B eventually merges with the path of liquid A.
Liquid B flows into container F.
Liquid C (Pink) starts from the top middle.
Liquid C flows directly downward, passing between the gray and pink baffles.
Liquid C merges with the path of liquid B.
Liquid C flows into container F.
Liquid D (Blue) begins at the top right.
Liquid D flows downward, diverting around the pink baffle.
Liquid D merges with the path of liquid C.
Liquid D flows into container F.
All liquids (A, B, C, and D) ultimately flow into container F after navigating the baffles.
The liquid will flow into container F.
